org.joda.pa

Interface MetaBean


  • public interface MetaBean
    A meta-bean, defining those aspects of a bean which are not specific to a particular instance, such as the type and set of meta-properties.

    This interface can be thought of as the equivalent of Class but for beans. It provides access to three main elements:

    • a Stream of properties, allowing the state of the bean to be queried
    • a Stream of annotations, allowing the annotations of the bean to be queried
    • a BeanBuilder that allows a new bean to be created

    Implementations of this interface will typically represent the properties and annotations of a fixed concrete class. However, implementations are permitted to be dynamic, creating properties and/or annotations on demand.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static MetaBean of(Class<?> cls)
        Obtains a meta-bean for a Class.

        A MetaBean provides an abstraction on top of a Class.

        Parameters:
        cls - the class whose associated MetaBean will be obtained
        Returns:
        the meta-bean associated with the class, not null

      • beanType

        Class<?> beanType()
        Gets the type of the bean, represented as a Class.

        A MetaBean can be thought of as the equivalent of Class but for beans. This method allows the actual Class instance of the bean to be obtained.

        Returns:
        the type of the bean, not null

      • isBuildable

        boolean isBuildable()
        Checks whether this bean is buildable or not.

        A buildable bean can be constructed using beanBuilder(). If this method returns true then beanBuilder() must return a valid builder. If this method returns false then beanBuilder() must throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        Returns:
        true if this bean is buildable

      • beanBuilder

        BeanBuilder<?> beanBuilder()
        Creates a bean builder that can be used to create an instance of this bean.

        The builder is used in two main ways. The first is to allow immutable beans to be constructed. The second is to enable automated tools like serialization/deserialization.

        The builder can be thought of as a Map of MetaProperty to value. Note that the implementation is not necessarily an actual map.

        Returns:
        the bean builder, not null
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the bean cannot be created
        See Also:
        isBuildable()

      • metaProperties

        java.util.stream.Stream<MetaProperty<?>> metaProperties()
        Gets the stream of properties associated with this bean.

        The properties are queried from the bean. This is typically accomplished by querying the properties of an underlying Class however any strategy is permitted.

        If the implementation has a mutable set of properties, then the result of this method must stream over those properties in existence when this method is called to avoid concurrency issues.

        Returns:
        the stream of properties on the bean, not null

      • metaProperty

        default Optional<MetaProperty<?>> metaProperty(String propertyName)
        Gets a single property by name.

        The properties are queried from the bean. This is typically accomplished by querying the properties of an underlying Class however any strategy is permitted. This method returns the property with the specified name, or an empty Optional if the name is not known.

        A dynamic implementation of this interface may create the property on demand when this method is called.

        The default implementation applies a filter to the result of metaProperties() and returns the first matching property.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to retrieve, null returns an empty Optional
        Returns:
        the property, or optional empty if no such property

      • annotations

        java.util.stream.Stream<Annotation> annotations()
        Gets the stream of annotations associated with this bean.

        The annotations are queried from the bean. This is typically accomplished by querying the annotations of an underlying Class however any strategy is permitted.

        If the implementation has a mutable set of annotations, then the result of this method must stream over those annotations in existence when this method is called to avoid concurrency issues.

        Returns:
        the stream of annotations, not null

      • annotations

        default <A extends Annotation> java.util.stream.Stream<A> annotations(Class<A> annotationType)
        Gets the stream of annotations associated with this bean by type.

        The annotations are queried from the bean. This is typically accomplished by querying the annotations of an underlying Class however any strategy is permitted.

        Call Stream.findFirst() on the result to obtain the first matching annotation if the type is not Repeatable.

        If the implementation has a mutable set of annotations, then the result of this method must stream over those annotations in existence when this method is called to avoid concurrency issues.

        The default implementation applies a filter and cast to the result of annotations().

        Type Parameters:
        A - the annotation type
        Parameters:
        annotationType - the annotation type to find, not null
        Returns:
        the annotations matching the specified type, not null
